body.p: Integrating EMC VNX 5300 unified hybrid storage arrays with Helion OpenStack allows you to consolidate multiple workloads and better manage unpredictable IT environments. EMC provides flash, capacity, and application-aware software. EMC's VNX hardware solutions provide a choice of systems ranging from entry-level solutions to high-performance, petabyte-capacity configurations servicing demanding application requirements.

If you already have EMC deployed in your environment and want to integrate it with Helion OpenStack, you can use this document to understand how Helion testers have successfully completed the process. The process involves meeting all of the hardware and network requirements, and installing and configuring the EMC drivers on all controller and compute nodes. Additionally, this topic provides sample test scenarios that have been used to verify integration with Helion OpenStack.
The following operations supported by EMC VNX 5300 were confirmed to also be supported by Helion OpenStack.

li.b: Create, delete, attach, and detach volumes
Copy an image to a volume
Create, list, and delete volume snapshots
Create a volume from a snapshot
Migration between two backends with volume type
Migration between two backends with different volume types (including Storagetype Thin to Thick)
Migration between two backends with different volume types (including Storagetype Thick to Thin)
Migration between same backends with different volume types (including Storagetype Thick & Thick)

body.note: The Cinder supported operations are listed in the Cinder Support Matrix
